title: Russia’s Nuclear Weapons Rhetoric: How Concerned Should We Be?
description: U.S. officials say they do not believe that Russia has decided to detonate a tactical device, but concerns are rising.

title: U.S. Seeks Removal of Iran From U.N. Women’s Rights Agency
description: At an informal meeting of the United Nations Security Council on Wednesday, the American ambassador called on the global community to give its “moral support” to protesters in Iran.

title: Angry Bolsonaro Supporters Protest in the Streets
description: Tens of thousands of people demonstrated in cities across Brazil, many of them demanding that the military stop the transfer of power to President-elect Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva.

title: Russia Rejoins Grain Deal, but Warns It Could Pull Out Again
description: The agreement allows Ukraine, a major food producer, to export grain by sea, easing the threat of famine in other countries.

title: Your Thursday Briefing: A Truce in Tigray
description: Plus North Korea fired a record number of missiles, and Russia rejoined the grail deal.

title: Dobby’s Grave Can Stay on a Beach in Wales, but Please Stop Giving Him Socks
description: After a grave site for the “Harry Potter” elf became a tourist attraction, tributes to the character prompted environmental concerns.

title: North Korea Sending Ammunition to Russia for War, White House Says
description: The national security spokesman, John Kirby, said that it was unclear if the munitions had reached Russia, but that in any case, they would not “change the course of the war.”

title: Ethiopia and Tigray Rebels Agree to End Civil War, Mediators Say
description: After two years of fighting that has left hundreds of thousands displaced and on the brink of starvation, the announcement came out of the latest round of peace talks in South Africa.

title: Israel’s Election: 5 Takeaways
description: Benjamin Netanyahu seems poised to take power again. But regardless of his fate, the election already highlights several trends that could have a lasting effect on Israel.

title: Iranian Authorities Crack Down on Protests at Apartment Complex
description: Iran’s security forces shot at windows and threw stun grenades in a raid at the Shahrak Ekbatan complex, where a member of the feared Basij militia was killed last week, residents said.

title: Kyiv Prepares 425 Shelters in Case of a Russian Nuclear Attack
description: Worries that the Kremlin might turn to its nuclear arsenal have deepened since President Vladimir V. Putin of Russia raised the specter in September of using such weapons to hold on to territorial gains.

title: Russia rejoins the grain deal after saying it received safety assurances.
Russia Says It Will Rejoin Deal Allowing Ukrainian Grain Shipments
description: Moscow announced it was resuming its participation in an international agreement aimed at helping countries facing acute food shortages.

title: The New Abortion Landscape
description: Women in states with abortion bans are turning to telemedicine.

title: Denmark’s Center-Left Coalition Wins Election Majority
description: An unpredictable race ultimately gave the governing Social Democratic Party its best showing in two decades, though analysts said it looked set to form a more centrist government.

title: Hurricane or Typhoon? How Tropical Cyclones Get Their Names.
description: There are variations around the world, particularly in the Western Pacific, in how countries name and measure tropical cyclones. We can explain.

title: Hurricane or Typhoon? How Tropical Cyclones Get Their Names.
description: There are variations around the world, particularly in the Western Pacific, in how countries name and measure tropical cyclones. We can explain.

title: As Climate Change Worsens, US Weighs Which Communities to Save
description: The Biden administration is considering proposals to relocate Native American communities threatened by global warming. It could become a template for the rest of the country.

title: After Covid Lockdown, Fear and Unrest Sweep iPhone Factory in China
description: Hundreds of workers are said to have fled, afraid of being forced into quarantine with inadequate food and supplies.

title: Netanyahu Extends Lead in Israel Election, Projections Say
description: If the right-wing bloc does cement an election victory, Benjamin Netanyahu, Israel’s longest-serving prime minister, will return to office even as he stands trial on corruption charges.

title: Trial of Kansas Teacher Who Joined ISIS Shows Family’s Deep Scars
description: Allison Fluke-Ekren, a teacher from Kansas, dragged her family to Syria and forced her daughter, Leyla, to train for war on behalf of the Islamic State. Now her daughter wields final words against her.

title: Your Wednesday Briefing
description: The latest developments from elections in Brazil, Denmark and Israel.

title: A Capital Draped in Darkness
description: The streets of Ukraine’s capital, illuminated with nightlife only weeks ago, are shrouded in darkness and shadows now because of restrictions on the use of electricity. The lack of light creates moments of apprehension, but also of beauty.

title: North Korea Launches 10 Missiles
description: People on an island took cover as one missile landed near South Korean territorial waters. The South promised to “ensure that North Korea pays a price.”

title: Netanyahu Holds Slight Lead in Israeli Election, Exit Polls Show
description: If the right-wing bloc does eke out a narrow victory, it would allow Mr. Netanyahu, Israel’s longest-serving prime minister, to return to office even as he stands trial on corruption charges.
